info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:00PM EDT until August 08 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MOORE...SCOTLAND...SOUTHERN ANSON...WESTERN HARNETT...RICHMOND...LEE AND CENTRAL HOKE COUNTIES... At 700 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sanford to near Raeford to near Hamlet, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Laurinburg, Southern Pines, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Pinehurst, Hamlet, Aberdeen, Maxton and Hoffman. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms have a history of producing widespread tree damage in Stanly and Montgomery Counties. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
